trans-unit.source: Provides a set of services for registering and unregistering managed assemblies for use from COM.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.InteropServices.RegistrationServices"></xref> class.
Returns the GUID of the COM category that contains the managed classes.
The GUID of the COM category that contains the managed classes.
Retrieves the COM ProgID for the specified type.
The type corresponding to the ProgID that is being requested.
The ProgID for the specified type.
Retrieves a list of classes in an assembly that would be registered by a call to <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.RegistrationServices.RegisterAssembly*>.
The assembly to search for classes.
A array containing a list of classes in assembly.
The assembly parameter is .
Registers the classes in a managed assembly to enable creation from COM.
`RegisterAssembly` adds the appropriate registry entries for the types in the specified assembly.
This method also calls any registration functions found in the assembly.
Use <xref:System.Reflection.Assembly.Load%2A?displayProperty=fullName> to get an assembly.
The assembly to be registered.
An <xref href="System.Runtime.InteropServices.AssemblyRegistrationFlags"></xref> value indicating any special settings used when registering `assembly`.
if assembly contains types that were successfully registered; otherwise if the assembly contains no eligible types.
assembly is .
The full name of assembly is .
-or- A method marked with <xref href="System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComRegisterFunctionAttribute"></xref> is not <xref uid="langword_csharp_static" name="static" href=""></xref>.
-or- There is more than one method marked with <xref href="System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComRegisterFunctionAttribute"></xref> at a given level of the hierarchy.
-or- The signature of the method marked with <xref href="System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComRegisterFunctionAttribute"></xref> is not valid.
A user-defined custom registration function (marked with the <xref href="System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComRegisterFunctionAttribute"></xref> attribute) throws an exception.
Registers the specified type with COM using the specified GUID.
This method is equivalent to calling `CoRegisterClassObject` in COM.
The RegisterTypeForComClients method is not atomic and can cause unpredictable results when used in a multithreaded context.
In version 2.0 and later, use the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.RegistrationServices.UnregisterTypeForComClients%2A> method to unregister a type in COM.
Note that using platform invoke to call the unmanaged `CoRegisterClassObject` and `CoDisconnectObject` methods for registration and unregistration of COM objects is not supported.
The <xref:System.Type> to be registered for use from COM.
The <xref:System.Guid> used to register the specified type.
The type parameter is .
The type parameter cannot be created.
Registers the specified type with COM using the specified execution context and connection type.
This method is equivalent to calling `CoRegisterClassObject` in COM.
The RegisterTypeForComClients method is not atomic and can cause unpredictable results when used in a multithreaded context.
In the .NET Framework version 2.0 and later, use the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.RegistrationServices.UnregisterTypeForComClients%2A> method to unregister a type in COM.
Note that using platform invoke to call the unmanaged `CoRegisterClassObject` and `CoDisconnectObject` methods for registration and unregistration of COM objects is not supported.
The <xref:System.Type> object to register for use from COM.
One of the <xref href="System.Runtime.InteropServices.RegistrationClassContext"></xref> values that indicates the context in which the executable code will be run.
One of the <xref href="System.Runtime.InteropServices.RegistrationConnectionType"></xref> values that specifies how connections are made to the class object.
An integer that represents a cookie value.
The type parameter is .
The type parameter cannot be created.

Indicates whether a type is marked with the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComImportAttribute>, or derives from a type marked with the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComImportAttribute> and shares the same GUID as the parent.
The type to check for being a COM type.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if a type is marked with the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComImportAttribute>, or derives from a type marked with the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComImportAttribute> and shares the same GUID as the parent; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Determines whether the specified type requires registration.
The type to check for COM registration requirements.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the type must be registered for use from COM; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Unregisters the classes in a managed assembly.
`UnregisterAssembly` removes the registry entries for the types in the specified assembly previously added by <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.RegistrationServices.RegisterAssembly%2A>.
This method also calls any unregistration functions found in the assembly.
The assembly to be unregistered.
if assembly contains types that were successfully unregistered; otherwise if the assembly contains no eligible types.
assembly is .
The full name of assembly is .
-or- A method marked with <xref href="System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComUnregisterFunctionAttribute"></xref> is not <xref uid="langword_csharp_static" name="static" href=""></xref>.
-or- There is more than one method marked with <xref href="System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComUnregisterFunctionAttribute"></xref> at a given level of the hierarchy.
-or- The signature of the method marked with <xref href="System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComUnregisterFunctionAttribute"></xref> is not valid.
A user-defined custom unregistration function (marked with the <xref href="System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComUnregisterFunctionAttribute"></xref> attribute) throws an exception.
Removes references to a type registered with the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.RegistrationServices.RegisterTypeForComClients*> method.
Note that using platform invoke to call the unmanaged `CoRegisterClassObject` and `CoDisconnectObject` methods to register and unregister COM objects is not supported.
The cookie value returned by a previous call to the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.RegistrationServices.RegisterTypeForComClients*> method overload.
